data.text:
Enrollment

Grades: Three-year-old program to grade 8

Number of students: 357

Academics

Average class size:

​Prep: 11–14

Lower & Upper School: 14–18

Student:Teacher ratio: 8:1

Accreditation:

National Association of Independent Schools

Faculty

Number of faculty: 44

Average tenure at EFS: 13 years

Athletics

Number of interscholastic sports: 5

Number of interscholastic teams: 18

Student body participation: 75%

Finances

Tuition for 2024-2025: $18,380–$22,274

Financial aid awarded for 2023-2024: $813,245

Percent of student body receiving aid: 38%

ERB Standardized Test Results

ERB tests are administered to students starting in third grade. The following statistics reflect how Elmwood Franklin School students performed on average over the past five years.

8th Grade Verbal Reasoning Results

67% ranked nationally at or above the 75th percentile

41% ranked nationally at or above the 90th percentile

8th Grade Reading Results

40% ranked nationally at or above the 75th percentile

19% ranked nationally at or above the 90th percentile

8th Grade Mathematics 1 & 2 Results

45% ranked nationally at or above the 75th percentile

36% ranked nationally at or above the 90th percentile

​8th Grade Quantitative Reasoning Results

61% ranked nationally at or above the 75th percentile

32% ranked nationally at or above the 90th percentile
